the effect of access to public facilities and spaces on—
maintenance of security and safety;

free speech, the right to petition the Government, and other constitutional rights and civil
			 liberties;
economies of affected jurisdictions or parts thereof;
physical changes and architectural aesthetics of affected areas;
traffic and congestion; and
job performance of employees within the affected facilities;
current and potential uses of technology to augment or replace traditional modes of security;
practices of and comparisons with other entities and nations; and

current and potential analytical methods of assessing the risks posed by the various forms of
			 terrorism, balanced against the specific needs and values of open access.
